arm_group.description: Patients with genetically and clincally proven PXE
Type 2 diabetic patients with mediacalcosis and matched to PXE patients for gender and age (+/- 5 yrs).
patients with chronic kidney disease and matched to PXE patients for gender and age (+/- 5 yrs).

brief_summary.textblock:
Quantification and preferential sites of arterial wall calcification within the coronary and
      lower legs arteries will be comared between Pseudo-Xanthoma elasticum(PXE) atients and type
      2 diabetics and Chronic Kidney disease.

clinical_study.brief_title: Arterial Wall Calcium Load in Pseudoxanthoma Elasticum

detailed_description.textblock:
In a previous work we have observed that patients suffering from PXE, a soft-tissue
      calcifying inherited autosomal disease, exhibited specific structural and functionnal
      features within the peripheral arteries. We now want to quantify and determine the
      preferential sites of the arterial wall calcification (Agatston score) between these
      patients compared to diabetics and patients with chronic renal insufficiency with
      mediacalcosis.

      All variables will be collected from a cohort of PXE monitored in our PXE Health and Care
      centre at the university hospital of Angers. Quantification of the arterial wall calcium
      load will be performed using helicoidal CT-scan. These variables will be compared to the
      same measurements performed in type 2 diabetic and chronic kidney disease patients paired by
      age and gender.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients  with phenotypically and genotypically-proven PXE

          -  Type 2 diabetic patients with mediacalcosis (i.e. Ankle Brachial Index > 1.30)

          -  Patients with a chronic kidney disease (CKD), before kidney transplantation

          -  All patients should be affiliated to a Health care system

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient with unproved PXE

          -  Patient under the age of 18 yrs

          -  Patient unwilling to participate to the study

          -  Pregnant women

          -  Patient not affiliated to a Health care system

clinical_study.official_title: Arterial Wall Calcium Load and Preferential Sites in Pseudoxanthoma Elasticum Versus Type 2 Diabetes and Chronic Kidney Disease.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Dermatology, University Hospital of Angers, France

primary_outcome.description: the level of arterial wall calcification determined by a Ct-scan and computed by the Agatston score

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: the anatomical site of arterial wall calcification determined by a Ct-scan and computed by the Agatston score

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
